name: places/ChIJ1dKl2r1YwokRAUhWAKmV2hI
formattedAddress: 1209 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1209 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA

originalText.text: Daquan provided me with exceptional service with a great personality helping me chose between a few frames I had seen on the website. I had a concern with keeping the glasses sterile because of a recent problem with an eye and he helped me clean the glasses before I tried them on. The price is so right and the selection is tops it’s so fun to shop there. It’s also spacious with helpful staff. I think this is my favorite of their location. I bought a pair at a different location and took advantage of their promotion to get a second pair. Loyal customer for life.

originalText.text: I went to the store on the upper East side. I was welcomed with a smile and greeting.Then an associate by the name of Arturo helped me. I had wanted glasses for people with little or no nose bridge. He observed I had a cane and a knee brace(healing torn meniscus). He offered to go upstairs and get options for me. I was appreciative and it showed professionalism and efficiency on his part. I also received help choosing the right pair for the shape of my face. This is important, because the wrong pair would not only look bad ; it could also not be appropriate for progressive lenses.In another store ,an associate was more concerned about up sizing to a brand name. That person did not know ,I am privy to game of glasses being made cheaply and sold to the unbeknownst buyer at a high price because of a" brand".That being said, I at least know I will get quality and a pair will be donated to a person in need. This was another motivational factor in choosing Warby.

originalText.text: Had to make adjustments to my new frames. They were squeezing my temples into oblivion. I decided to drop by this specific location for the first time ever. I dug the aesthetics, the old school pharmacy sign out front. Giant eyewear displays, lots of staff, who were very friendly and accommodating. I didn’t have to wait long. The young lady at the reference desk was very kind and helpful. I didn’t get her name but the lady with the piercings. Model employee. She worked magic on these frames. This is a great example of how a business should run. Originally, I wasn’t sure if I should go to the Lexington location over the Brooklyn one but in the end, I definitely made the right choice. Highly recommend Warby Parker in general but I recommend this particular location the most out of the other ones.

originalText.text:
The frame breaks, I stop by and they solution was: buy another one because this can’t be fixed. I asked is this supposed to break that quick? Then they didn’t like my question and basically keep repeating I should just got a new one. Will never, ever buy again
PS: If I had read the reviews before I would NOT had lost my money as it happens similar with another client.

originalText.text: I recently had skin cancer on my eyelid so 40% of my right eye lid was removed.  I’ve never needed glasses before but my doctor recommended getting a UV prescription glasses or wear sunglasses. The crux of my issue is that I suffer from color blindness, so in low light wearing sunglasses makes it almost impossible to see and I end up walking into things unintentionally.  I went to Warby Parker in my neighborhood after doing some research online, I was met by a very pleasant and helpful sales associate by the name of Eric.  I explained to him my situation and describe the style of frame I was looking for. He was very helpful and made the entire process of buying my first pair of glasses that were not sunglasses more enjoyable than any other glasses purchase I’ve ever made.  Give this man a raise!
